shrimp.name: WardPDF
shrimp.author: rconstruct

input.name: envmap
input.description: Environment map to use with no ray hits

shrimp.usage: This block generates a distribution of rays according to the Ward PDF. If the values of "ax" and "ay" (the apparent surface roughness along the X and Y directions respectively) are identical, then isotropic Ward distribution is used, otherwise, the anisotropic Ward distribution is used instead. The variable "samples" specifies the number of rays to generate, and since this increases the number of loop iterations, increasing the number of rays, increases also the render times (but reduces noise). The "envmap" variable contains the environment map to use when there are no ray intersections.The variables "envspace" controls the space transformation for the ray used for the environment lookup, while "filter", "envsamples", "width", "envblur" control the environment lookup respectively.
